  • java.lang.Object

      • createComponent

        public javax.swing.JComponent createComponent()
        Description copied from interface: UnnamedConfigurable
        Creates new Swing form that enables user to configure the settings. Usually this method is called on the EDT, so it should not take a long time.

        Also this place is designed to allocate resources (subscriptions/listeners etc.)

        Specified by:
        createComponent in interface UnnamedConfigurable
        Returns:
        new Swing form to show, or null if it cannot be created
        See Also:
        UnnamedConfigurable.disposeUIResources()

        public boolean isModified()
        Description copied from interface: UnnamedConfigurable

        Specified by:

      • apply

        public void apply()
           throws ConfigurationException
        Description copied from interface: UnnamedConfigurable
        Stores the settings from the Swing form to the configurable component. This method is called on EDT upon user's request.
        Specified by:

        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - if values cannot be applied

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from interface: UnnamedConfigurable
        Loads the settings from the configurable component to the Swing form. This method is called on EDT immediately after the form creation or later upon user's request.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface UnnamedConfigurable

      • enableSearch

        public java.lang.Runnable enableSearch(java.lang.String option)
        Specified by:
        enableSearch in interface SearchableConfigurable
        Parameters:
        option - setting search query
        Returns:
        an action to perform when this configurable is opened when a search filter query is entered by the user in setting dialog. This action, for example, can select something in a tree or a list embedded in this setting page that matches the query.
